=== proportional vote === 
under such a system , elector would be select in proportion to the vote cast for they candidate or party , rather than be select by the statewide plurality vote . 
=== congressional district method === 
there be two version of the congressional district method : one have be implement in Maine and Nebraska ; another that have be propose in Virginia . 
there be two version of the congressional district method : one have be implement in Maine and Nebraska ; another that have be propose in Virginia . under the implement Congressional District Method , the electoral vote be distribute base on the popular vote winner within each of the state 's congressional district ; the statewide popular vote winner receive two additional electoral vote . 
in 2013 , a different version of the Congressional District Method be propose in Virginia .

the Congressional District Method can more easily be implement than other alternative to the winner-takes-all method . State legislation be sufficient to use this method . advocate of the Congressional District Method believe the system would encourage higher voter turnout and incentivize presidential candidate to broaden they campaign in non-competitive state . winner-take-all system ignore thousand of popular vote ; in democratic California there be republican district , in Republican Texas there be democratic district . because candidate have a incentive to campaign in competitive district , with a district plan , candidate have a incentive to actively campaign in over thirty state versus seven `` swing '' state . opponent of the system , however , argue that candidate might only spend time in certain battleground district instead of the entire state and case of gerrymandering could become exacerbated as political party attempt to draw as many safe district as they can .

the United States be the only country that elect a politically powerful president via a electoral college and the only one in which a candidate can become president without have obtain the highest number of vote in the sole or final round of popular voting . 
==== exclusive focus on large swing state ==== 
== criticism ==

==== discourage turnout and participation ==== 
except in closely fight swing state , voter turnout be largely insignificant due to entrenched political party domination in most state . 
except in closely fight swing state , voter turnout be largely insignificant due to entrenched political party domination in most state . the Electoral College decrease the advantage a political party or campaign might gain for encouraging voter to turn out , except in those swing state . 
except in closely fight swing state , voter turnout be largely insignificant due to entrenched political party domination in most state . the Electoral College decrease the advantage a political party or campaign might gain for encouraging voter to turn out , except in those swing state . if the presidential election be decide by a national popular vote , in contrast , campaign and party would have a strong incentive to work to increase turnout everywhere . 
except in closely fight swing state , voter turnout be largely insignificant due to entrenched political party domination in most state . the Electoral College decrease the advantage a political party or campaign might gain for encouraging voter to turn out , except in those swing state . if the presidential election be decide by a national popular vote , in contrast , campaign and party would have a strong incentive to work to increase turnout everywhere . individual would similarly have a stronger incentive to persuade they friend and neighbor to turn out to vote . 
except in closely fight swing state , voter turnout be largely insignificant due to entrenched political party domination in most state . the Electoral College decrease the advantage a political party or campaign might gain for encouraging voter to turn out , except in those swing state . if the presidential election be decide by a national popular vote , in contrast , campaign and party would have a strong incentive to work to increase turnout everywhere . individual would similarly have a stronger incentive to persuade they friend and neighbor to turn out to vote . the difference in turnout between swing state and non-swing state under the current electoral college system suggest that replace the Electoral College with direct election by popular vote would likely increase turnout and participation significantly . 
==== obscure disenfranchisement within state ==== 
accord to this criticism , the electoral college reduce election to a mere count of elector for a particular state , and , as a result , it obscure any voting problem within a particular state . 
accord to this criticism , the electoral college reduce election to a mere count of elector for a particular state , and , as a result , it obscure any voting problem within a particular state . for example , if a particular state block some group from voting , perhaps by voter suppression method such as impose reading test , poll tax , registration requirement , or legally disfranchise specific minority group , then vote inside that state would be reduce . 
accord to this criticism , the electoral college reduce election to a mere count of elector for a particular state , and , as a result , it obscure any voting problem within a particular state . for example , if a particular state block some group from voting , perhaps by voter suppression method such as impose reading test , poll tax , registration requirement , or legally disfranchise specific minority group , then vote inside that state would be reduce . but the state 's electoral count would be the same .

today , the presidential election process remain controversial , with critic argue that it be inherently undemocratic , and discourage voter participation and turnout in many area of the country . because of the staggered nature of the primary season , voter in Iowa , New Hampshire and other small state which traditionally hold they primary and caucus first in January usually have a major impact on the race . campaign activity , media attention , and voter participation be usually higher in these state , as the candidate attempt to build momentum and generate a bandwagon effect in these early primary .

with the primary race usually over before June , the political convention have mostly become script , ceremonial affair . as the drama have leave the convention , and complaint grow that they be script and dull pep rally , public interest and viewership have fall off . after formerly offer gavel-to-gavel coverage of the major party convention in the mid-20th Century , the Big three television network now only devote approximately three hour of coverage -lrb- one hour per night -rrb- .

critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support .

critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support . such swing state like Ohio be inundate with campaign visit , saturation television advertising , get-out-the-vote effort by party organizer , and debate . meanwhile , candidate and political party have no incentive to mount nationwide campaign effort , or work to increase voter turnout , in predominately democratic Party `` safe state '' like California or predominately Republican Party `` safe state '' like Texas . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support . such swing state like Ohio be inundate with campaign visit , saturation television advertising , get-out-the-vote effort by party organizer , and debate . meanwhile , candidate and political party have no incentive to mount nationwide campaign effort , or work to increase voter turnout , in predominately democratic Party `` safe state '' like California or predominately Republican Party `` safe state '' like Texas . in practice , the winner-take-all system also both reinforce the country 's two-party system and decrease the importance of third and minor political party . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support . such swing state like Ohio be inundate with campaign visit , saturation television advertising , get-out-the-vote effort by party organizer , and debate . meanwhile , candidate and political party have no incentive to mount nationwide campaign effort , or work to increase voter turnout , in predominately democratic Party `` safe state '' like California or predominately Republican Party `` safe state '' like Texas . in practice , the winner-take-all system also both reinforce the country 's two-party system and decrease the importance of third and minor political party . furthermore , a candidate can win the electoral vote without secure the greatest amount of the national popular vote , such as during the 1824 , 1876 , 1888 , and 2000 election . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support . such swing state like Ohio be inundate with campaign visit , saturation television advertising , get-out-the-vote effort by party organizer , and debate . meanwhile , candidate and political party have no incentive to mount nationwide campaign effort , or work to increase voter turnout , in predominately democratic Party `` safe state '' like California or predominately Republican Party `` safe state '' like Texas . in practice , the winner-take-all system also both reinforce the country 's two-party system and decrease the importance of third and minor political party . furthermore , a candidate can win the electoral vote without secure the greatest amount of the national popular vote , such as during the 1824 , 1876 , 1888 , and 2000 election . in theory , it be possible to secure the necessary 270 electoral vote from just the top 11 populous state and then ignore the rest of the country . 
Constitutional amendment , such as the every vote count Amendment , have be propose seek to replace the Electoral College with a direct popular vote , which proponent argue would increase turnout and participation . 
Constitutional amendment , such as the every vote count Amendment , have be propose seek to replace the Electoral College with a direct popular vote , which proponent argue would increase turnout and participation . other propose reform include the National Popular vote Interstate Compact , a interstate compact without congressional authorization , whereby individual participate state agree to allocate they elector base on the winner of the national popular vote , instead of vote they respective statewide result . 
Constitutional amendment , such as the every vote count Amendment , have be propose seek to replace the Electoral College with a direct popular vote , which proponent argue would increase turnout and participation . other propose reform include the National Popular vote Interstate Compact , a interstate compact without congressional authorization , whereby individual participate state agree to allocate they elector base on the winner of the national popular vote , instead of vote they respective statewide result . another proposal be for every state to simply adopt the District system use by Maine and Nebraska : give two electoral vote to the statewide winner and one electoral vote to the winner of each Congressional district .

==== encourage stability through the two-party system ==== 
== origin == 
many proponent of the Electoral College see its negative effect on third party as beneficial . 
many proponent of the Electoral College see its negative effect on third party as beneficial . they argue that the two party system have provide stability because it encourage a delay adjustment during time of rapid political and cultural change . 
many proponent of the Electoral College see its negative effect on third party as beneficial . they argue that the two party system have provide stability because it encourage a delay adjustment during time of rapid political and cultural change . they believe it protect the most powerful office in the country from control by what these proponent view as regional minority until they can moderate they view to win broad , long-term support across the nation . 
many proponent of the Electoral College see its negative effect on third party as beneficial . they argue that the two party system have provide stability because it encourage a delay adjustment during time of rapid political and cultural change . they believe it protect the most powerful office in the country from control by what these proponent view as regional minority until they can moderate they view to win broad , long-term support across the nation . advocate of a national popular vote for president suggest that this effect would also be true in popular vote election .

the first power the Constitution confer upon the president be the veto . 
the first power the Constitution confer upon the president be the veto . the Presentment clause require any bill pass by Congress to be present to the president before it can become law . 
the first power the Constitution confer upon the president be the veto . the Presentment clause require any bill pass by Congress to be present to the president before it can become law . once the legislation have be present , the president have three option : 
sign the legislation ; the bill then become law . 
veto the legislation and return it to Congress , express any objection ; the bill do not become law , unless each house of Congress vote to override the veto by a two-third vote .

in 1996 , Congress attempt to enhance the president 's veto power with the Line Item Veto Act . the legislation empower the president to sign any spending bill into law while simultaneously striking certain spending item within the bill , particularly any new spending , any amount of discretionary spending , or any new limited tax benefit . Congress could then repass that particular item . if the president then veto the new legislation , Congress could override the veto by its ordinary means , a two-third vote in both house . in Clinton v. City of New York , 524 U.S. 417 -lrb- 1998 -rrb- , the U.S. Supreme Court rule such a legislative alteration of the veto power to be unconstitutional .

Historically , two doctrine concern executive power have develop that enable the president to exercise executive power with a degree of autonomy . the first be executive privilege , which allow the president to withhold from disclosure any communication make directly to the president in the performance of executive duty . George Washington first claim privilege when Congress request to see Chief Justice John Jay 's note from a unpopular treaty negotiation with great Britain . while not enshrine in the Constitution , or any other law , Washington 's action create the precedent for the privilege . when Richard Nixon try to use executive privilege as a reason for not turn over subpoena evidence to Congress during the Watergate scandal , the Supreme Court rule in United States v. Nixon , 418 U.S. 683 -lrb- 1974 -rrb- , that executive privilege do not apply in case where a president be attempt to avoid criminal prosecution .

the state secret privilege allow the president and the executive branch to withhold information or document from discovery in legal proceedings if such release would harm national security . 
the state secret privilege allow the president and the executive branch to withhold information or document from discovery in legal proceedings if such release would harm national security . precedent for the privilege arise early in the 19th century when Thomas Jefferson refuse to release military document in the treason trial of Aaron Burr and again in Totten v. United States 92 U.S. 105 -lrb- 1876 -rrb- , when the Supreme Court dismiss a case bring by a former Union spy . 
the state secret privilege allow the president and the executive branch to withhold information or document from discovery in legal proceedings if such release would harm national security . precedent for the privilege arise early in the 19th century when Thomas Jefferson refuse to release military document in the treason trial of Aaron Burr and again in Totten v. United States 92 U.S. 105 -lrb- 1876 -rrb- , when the Supreme Court dismiss a case bring by a former Union spy . however , the privilege be not formally recognize by the U.S. Supreme Court until United States v. Reynolds 345 U.S. 1 -lrb- 1953 -rrb- , where it be hold to be a common law evidentiary privilege .

the Constitution 's Ineligibility clause prevent the President -lrb- and all other executive officer -rrb- from simultaneously be a member of Congress . therefore , the president can not directly introduce legislative proposal for consideration in Congress . however , the president can take a indirect role in shape legislation , especially if the president 's political party have a majority in one or both house of Congress . for example , the president or other official of the executive branch may draft legislation and then ask senator or representative to introduce these draft into Congress .

=== ceremonial role === 
as head of state , the president can fulfill tradition establish by previous president . 
as head of state , the president can fulfill tradition establish by previous president . William Howard Taft start the tradition of throw out the ceremonial first pitch in 1910 at Griffith Stadium , Washington , D.C. , on the Washington Senators ' Opening Day . 
as head of state , the president can fulfill tradition establish by previous president . William Howard Taft start the tradition of throw out the ceremonial first pitch in 1910 at Griffith Stadium , Washington , D.C. , on the Washington Senators ' Opening Day . every president since Taft , except for Jimmy Carter , throw out at least one ceremonial first ball or pitch for Opening Day , the All-Star Game , or the World Series , usually with much fanfare .

Article two of the United States Constitution provide that the President and Vice President of the United States must be natural-born citizen of the United States at least 35 year old , and a resident of the United States for a period of at least 14 year . candidate for the presidency typically seek the nomination of one of the political party of the United States , in which case each party devise a method -lrb- such as a primary election -rrb- to choose the candidate the party deem best suit to run for the position . the primary election be usually indirect election where voter cast ballot for a slate of party delegate pledge to a particular candidate . the party 's delegate then officially nominate a candidate to run on the party 's behalf . the general election in November be also a indirect election , where voter cast ballot for a slate of member of the Electoral College ; these elector in turn directly elect the President and Vice President .

Article II , Section 1 , clause 5 of the Constitution set the follow qualification for hold the presidency : 
be a natural-born citizen of the United States ; 
be at least thirty-five year old ; 
be a resident in the United States for at least fourteen year . 
the Twelfth Amendment preclude anyone ineligible to be the president from become the vice president .

=== campaign and nomination === 
the modern presidential campaign begin before the primary election , which the two major political party use to clear the field of candidate before they national nominating convention , where the most successful candidate be make the party 's nominee for president . 
the modern presidential campaign begin before the primary election , which the two major political party use to clear the field of candidate before they national nominating convention , where the most successful candidate be make the party 's nominee for president . typically , the party 's presidential candidate choose a vice presidential nominee , and this choice be rubber-stamp by the convention . 
the modern presidential campaign begin before the primary election , which the two major political party use to clear the field of candidate before they national nominating convention , where the most successful candidate be make the party 's nominee for president . typically , the party 's presidential candidate choose a vice presidential nominee , and this choice be rubber-stamp by the convention . the most common previous profession by U.S. president be lawyer .

the president be elect indirectly . a number of elector , collectively know as the Electoral College , officially select the president . on Election Day , voter in each of the state and the District of Columbia cast ballot for these elector . each state be allocate a number of elector , equal to the size of its delegation in both house of Congress combine . generally , the ticket that win the most vote in a state win all of that state 's electoral vote and thus have its slate of elector choose to vote in the Electoral College .

=== vacancy or disability === 
vacancy in the office of President may arise under several possible circumstance : death , resignation and removal from office . 
Article II , Section 4 of the Constitution allow the House of Representatives to impeach high federal official , include the president , for `` treason , bribery , or other high crime and misdemeanor . '' 
Article II , Section 4 of the Constitution allow the House of Representatives to impeach high federal official , include the president , for `` treason , bribery , or other high crime and misdemeanor . '' Article I , Section 3 , clause 6 give the Senate the power to remove impeach official from office , give a two-third vote to convict . 
Article II , Section 4 of the Constitution allow the House of Representatives to impeach high federal official , include the president , for `` treason , bribery , or other high crime and misdemeanor . '' Article I , Section 3 , clause 6 give the Senate the power to remove impeach official from office , give a two-third vote to convict . the House have thus far impeach two president : Andrew Johnson in 1868 and Bill Clinton in 1998 .

under section 4 of the twenty-fifth amendment , the vice president , in conjunction with a majority of the Cabinet , may transfer the presidential power and duty from the president to the vice president by transmit a write declaration to the Speaker of the House and the president pro tempore of the Senate that the president be unable to discharge the presidential power and duty . 
under section 4 of the twenty-fifth amendment , the vice president , in conjunction with a majority of the Cabinet , may transfer the presidential power and duty from the president to the vice president by transmit a write declaration to the Speaker of the House and the president pro tempore of the Senate that the president be unable to discharge the presidential power and duty . if this occur , then the vice president will assume the presidential power and duty as act president ; however , the president can declare that no such inability exist and resume the discharge of the presidential power and duty . 
under section 4 of the twenty-fifth amendment , the vice president , in conjunction with a majority of the Cabinet , may transfer the presidential power and duty from the president to the vice president by transmit a write declaration to the Speaker of the House and the president pro tempore of the Senate that the president be unable to discharge the presidential power and duty . if this occur , then the vice president will assume the presidential power and duty as act president ; however , the president can declare that no such inability exist and resume the discharge of the presidential power and duty . if the vice president and Cabinet contest this claim , it be up to Congress , which must meet within two day if not already in session , to decide the merit of the claim .

the United States Constitution mention the resignation of the president , but do not regulate its form or the condition for its validity .

section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . 
section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 provide that if the office of President and Vice President be each either vacant or be hold by a disabled person , the next officer in the presidential line of succession , the Speaker of the House , become acting president . 
section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 provide that if the office of President and Vice President be each either vacant or be hold by a disabled person , the next officer in the presidential line of succession , the Speaker of the House , become acting president . the line then extend to the President pro tempore of the Senate , follow by every member of the Cabinet . 
section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 provide that if the office of President and Vice President be each either vacant or be hold by a disabled person , the next officer in the presidential line of succession , the Speaker of the House , become acting president . the line then extend to the President pro tempore of the Senate , follow by every member of the Cabinet . these person must fulfill all eligibility requirement of the office of President to be eligible to become acting president ; ineligible individual be skip . 
section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 provide that if the office of President and Vice President be each either vacant or be hold by a disabled person , the next officer in the presidential line of succession , the Speaker of the House , become acting president . the line then extend to the President pro tempore of the Senate , follow by every member of the Cabinet . these person must fulfill all eligibility requirement of the office of President to be eligible to become acting president ; ineligible individual be skip . there have never be a special election for the office of President .

Blair House , located next to the Eisenhower Executive Office Building at the White House complex and Lafayette Park , be a complex of four connected townhouse exceed 70,000 square foot -lrb- 6,500 m2 -rrb- of floor space which serve as the president 's official guest house and as a secondary residence for the president if need .

the United States Electoral College be the institution that elect the President and Vice President of the United States every four year . 
the United States Electoral College be the institution that elect the President and Vice President of the United States every four year . Citizens of the United States do not directly elect the president or the vice president ; instead , these voter directly elect designate intermediary call `` elector , '' who almost always have pledge to vote for particular presidential and vice presidential candidate -lrb- though unpledged elector be possible -rrb- and who be themselves select accord to the particular law of each state .

the United States Electoral College be the institution that elect the President and Vice President of the United States every four year . Citizens of the United States do not directly elect the president or the vice president ; instead , these voter directly elect designate intermediary call `` elector , '' who almost always have pledge to vote for particular presidential and vice presidential candidate -lrb- though unpledged elector be possible -rrb- and who be themselves select accord to the particular law of each state . elector be apportion to each of the 50 state as well as to the District of Columbia -lrb- also know as Washington , D.C. -rrb- . the number of elector in each state be equal to the number of member of Congress to which the state be entitle , while the twenty-third amendment grant the District of Columbia the same number of elector as the least populous state , currently three . 
the United States Electoral College be the institution that elect the President and Vice President of the United States every four year . Citizens of the United States do not directly elect the president or the vice president ; instead , these voter directly elect designate intermediary call `` elector , '' who almost always have pledge to vote for particular presidential and vice presidential candidate -lrb- though unpledged elector be possible -rrb- and who be themselves select accord to the particular law of each state . elector be apportion to each of the 50 state as well as to the District of Columbia -lrb- also know as Washington , D.C. -rrb- . the number of elector in each state be equal to the number of member of Congress to which the state be entitle , while the twenty-third amendment grant the District of Columbia the same number of elector as the least populous state , currently three . therefore , there be currently 538 elector , correspond to the 435 representative and 100 senator , plus the three additional elector from the District of Columbia . 
the United States Electoral College be the institution that elect the President and Vice President of the United States every four year . Citizens of the United States do not directly elect the president or the vice president ; instead , these voter directly elect designate intermediary call `` elector , '' who almost always have pledge to vote for particular presidential and vice presidential candidate -lrb- though unpledged elector be possible -rrb- and who be themselves select accord to the particular law of each state . elector be apportion to each of the 50 state as well as to the District of Columbia -lrb- also know as Washington , D.C. -rrb- . the number of elector in each state be equal to the number of member of Congress to which the state be entitle , while the twenty-third amendment grant the District of Columbia the same number of elector as the least populous state , currently three . therefore , there be currently 538 elector , correspond to the 435 representative and 100 senator , plus the three additional elector from the District of Columbia . the Constitution bar any federal official , elect or appoint , from be a elector .

in the Federalist Papers , James Madison explain he view on the selection of the president and the Constitution . in Federalist No. 39 , Madison argue that the Constitution be design to be a mixture of state-based and population-based government . Congress would have two house : the state-based Senate and the population-based House of Representatives . meanwhile , the president would be elect by a mixture of the two mode . additionally , in the Federalist no. 10 , James Madison argue against `` a interested and overbearing majority '' and the `` mischief of faction '' in a electoral system . he define a faction as `` a number of citizen whether amount to a majority or minority of the whole , who be unite and actuate by some common impulse of passion , or of interest , adverse to the rights of other citizen , or to the permanent and aggregate interest of the community . although the United States Constitution refer to `` elector '' and `` elector '' , neither the phrase `` Electoral College '' nor any other name be use to describe the elector collectively . it be not until the early 19th century that the name `` Electoral College '' come into general usage as the collective designation for the elector select to cast vote for president and vice president . 
although the United States Constitution refer to `` elector '' and `` elector '' , neither the phrase `` Electoral College '' nor any other name be use to describe the elector collectively . it be not until the early 19th century that the name `` Electoral College '' come into general usage as the collective designation for the elector select to cast vote for president and vice president . it be first write into federal law in 1845 and today the term appear in 3 U.S.C.  4 , in the section head and in the text as `` college of elector '' .

the emergence of political party and nationally coordinate election campaign soon complicate matter in the election of 1796 and 1800 . 
the emergence of political party and nationally coordinate election campaign soon complicate matter in the election of 1796 and 1800 . in 1796 , Federalist Party candidate John Adams win the presidential election ; by finish in second place , Democratic-Republican Party candidate Thomas Jefferson , the Federalists ' opponent , become the vice president .

=== fourteenth amendment === 
section 2 of the fourteenth amendment allow for a state 's representation in the House of Representatives to be reduce to the extent that state unconstitutionally deny people the right to vote .

== Modern mechanic == 
the election of President and Vice President of the United States be a indirect election in which citizen of the United States who be register to vote in one of the fifty state or Washington , D.C. cast ballot for a set of member of the U.S. Electoral College , know as elector . 
the election of President and Vice President of the United States be a indirect election in which citizen of the United States who be register to vote in one of the fifty state or Washington , D.C. cast ballot for a set of member of the U.S. Electoral College , know as elector . these elector then in turn cast direct vote , know as electoral vote , for President and Vice President of the United States . 
the election of President and Vice President of the United States be a indirect election in which citizen of the United States who be register to vote in one of the fifty state or Washington , D.C. cast ballot for a set of member of the U.S. Electoral College , know as elector . these elector then in turn cast direct vote , know as electoral vote , for President and Vice President of the United States . the candidate who receive a absolute majority of electoral vote for President or Vice President be then elect to that office . 
the election of President and Vice President of the United States be a indirect election in which citizen of the United States who be register to vote in one of the fifty state or Washington , D.C. cast ballot for a set of member of the U.S. Electoral College , know as elector . these elector then in turn cast direct vote , know as electoral vote , for President and Vice President of the United States . the candidate who receive a absolute majority of electoral vote for President or Vice President be then elect to that office . if no candidate receive a absolute majority for President , the House of Representatives choose the President ; if no one receive a majority for Vice President , then the Senate choose the Vice President . 
the election of President and Vice President of the United States be a indirect election in which citizen of the United States who be register to vote in one of the fifty state or Washington , D.C. cast ballot for a set of member of the U.S. Electoral College , know as elector . these elector then in turn cast direct vote , know as electoral vote , for President and Vice President of the United States . the candidate who receive a absolute majority of electoral vote for President or Vice President be then elect to that office . if no candidate receive a absolute majority for President , the House of Representatives choose the President ; if no one receive a majority for Vice President , then the Senate choose the Vice President . the Electoral College and its procedure be establish in the U.S. Constitution by Article II , Section 1 , clause 2 and 4 ; and the Twelfth Amendment -lrb- which replace clause 3 after it be ratify in 1804 -rrb- .

the modern nominating process of U.S. presidential election currently consist of two major part : a series of presidential primary election and caucus hold in each state , and the presidential nominating convention hold by each political party . 
the modern nominating process of U.S. presidential election currently consist of two major part : a series of presidential primary election and caucus hold in each state , and the presidential nominating convention hold by each political party . this process be never include in the United States Constitution , and thus evolve over time by the political party to clear the field of candidate .

unlike the general election , voter in the U.S. territory can also elect delegate to the national convention . furthermore , each political party can determine how many delegate to allocate to each state and territory . in 2012 for example , the democratic and republican party convention each use two different formula to allocate delegate . the Democrats base theirs on two main factor : -lrb- 1 -rrb- the proportion of vote each state give to the democratic candidate in the previous three presidential election , and -lrb- 2 -rrb- the number of electoral vote each state have in the Electoral College . in contrast , the Republicans assign to each state 10 delegate , plus 3 delegate per congressional district . both party then give fix amount of delegate to each territory , and finally bonus delegate to state and territory that pass certain criterion .

==== faithlessness ==== 
under the United States Constitution , the manner of choose elector for the Electoral College be determine by each state 's legislature . 
under the United States Constitution , the manner of choose elector for the Electoral College be determine by each state 's legislature . although each state currently designate elector by popular vote , other method be allow . 
under the United States Constitution , the manner of choose elector for the Electoral College be determine by each state 's legislature . although each state currently designate elector by popular vote , other method be allow . for instance , a number of state formerly choose presidential elector by a vote of the state legislature itself . 
however , federal law do specify that all elector must be select on the same day , which be `` the first Tuesday after the first Monday in November , '' i.e. a Tuesday no earlier than November 2 and no later than November 8 . 
however , federal law do specify that all elector must be select on the same day , which be `` the first Tuesday after the first Monday in November , '' i.e. a Tuesday no earlier than November 2 and no later than November 8 . today , the state and the District of Columbia each conduct they own popular election on Election Day to help determine they respective slate of elector . 
however , federal law do specify that all elector must be select on the same day , which be `` the first Tuesday after the first Monday in November , '' i.e. a Tuesday no earlier than November 2 and no later than November 8 . today , the state and the District of Columbia each conduct they own popular election on Election Day to help determine they respective slate of elector . thus , the presidential election be really a amalgamation of separate and simultaneous state election instead of a single national election run by the federal government .

like any other election in the United States , the eligibility of a individual for voting be set out in the Constitution and regulate at state level . the Constitution state that suffrage can not be deny on grounds of race or color , sex or age for citizen eighteen year or older . beyond these basic qualification , it be the responsibility of state legislature to regulate voter eligibility .

many voting ballot allow a voter to `` blanket vote '' for all candidate in a particular political party or to select individual candidate on a line by line voting system . which candidate appear on the voting ticket be determine through a legal process know as ballot access . usually , the size of the candidate 's political party and the result of the major nomination convention determine who be pre-listed on the presidential ballot . thus , the presidential election ticket will not list every candidate run for President , but only those who have secure a major party nomination or whose size of they political party warrant have be formally list . 
many voting ballot allow a voter to `` blanket vote '' for all candidate in a particular political party or to select individual candidate on a line by line voting system . which candidate appear on the voting ticket be determine through a legal process know as ballot access . usually , the size of the candidate 's political party and the result of the major nomination convention determine who be pre-listed on the presidential ballot . thus , the presidential election ticket will not list every candidate run for President , but only those who have secure a major party nomination or whose size of they political party warrant have be formally list . law be in effect to have other candidate pre-list on a ticket , provide that enough voter have endorse the candidate , usually through a signature list .

Blair , 343 U.S. 214 -lrb- 1952 -rrb- . the Court rule in favor of state law require elector to pledge to vote for the win candidate , as well as remove elector who refuse to pledge . as state in the ruling , elector be act as a functionary of the state , not the federal government . therefore , state have the right to govern elector .

Blair , 343 U.S. 214 -lrb- 1952 -rrb- . the Court rule in favor of state law require elector to pledge to vote for the win candidate , as well as remove elector who refuse to pledge . as state in the ruling , elector be act as a functionary of the state , not the federal government . therefore , state have the right to govern elector . the constitutionality of state law punish elector for actually cast a faithless vote , rather than refuse to pledge , have never be decide by the Supreme Court .

=== Electoral college === 
most state law establish a winner-take-all system , wherein the ticket that win a plurality of vote win all of that state 's allocate electoral vote , and thus have they slate of elector choose to vote in the Electoral College . 
most state law establish a winner-take-all system , wherein the ticket that win a plurality of vote win all of that state 's allocate electoral vote , and thus have they slate of elector choose to vote in the Electoral College . Maine and Nebraska do not use this method , opt instead to give two electoral vote to the statewide winner and one electoral vote to the winner of each Congressional district .

the Constitution give each state legislature the power to decide how its state 's elector be choose and it can be easier and cheaper for a state legislature to simply appoint a slate of elector than to create a legislative framework for hold election to determine the elector . as note above , the two situation in which legislative choice have be use since the civil war have both be because there be not enough time or money to prepare for a election . however , appointment by state legislature can have negative consequence : bicameral legislature can deadlock more easily than the electorate . this be precisely what happen to New York in 1789 when the legislature fail to appoint any elector . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support . such swing state like Ohio be inundate with campaign visit , saturation television advertising , get-out-the-vote effort by party organizer , and debate . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support . such swing state like Ohio be inundate with campaign visit , saturation television advertising , get-out-the-vote effort by party organizer , and debate . meanwhile , candidate and political party have no incentive to mount nationwide campaign effort , or work to increase voter turnout , in predominately democratic Party `` safe state '' like California or predominately Republican Party `` safe state '' like Texas . 
critic also argue that the Electoral College be archaic and inherently undemocratic . with all but two state -lrb- the exception be Maine and Nebraska -rrb- use a winner-take-all system , both the democratic and the Republican candidate be all but certain to win all the electoral vote from those state whose resident predominantly vote for the Democratic Party or the Republican Party , respectively . this encourage presidential candidate to focus exponentially more time , money , and energy campaigning in a few so-called `` swing state '' , state in which no single candidate or party have overwhelming support . such swing state like Ohio be inundate with campaign visit , saturation television advertising , get-out-the-vote effort by party organizer , and debate . meanwhile , candidate and political party have no incentive to mount nationwide campaign effort , or work to increase voter turnout , in predominately democratic Party `` safe state '' like California or predominately Republican Party `` safe state '' like Texas . in practice , the winner-take-all system also both reinforce the country 's two-party system and decrease the importance of third and minor political party .

in 1776 , the thirteen colony , act through the second Continental Congress , declare political independence from great Britain during the american revolution . the new state , though independent of each other as nation state , recognize the necessity of closely coordinate they effort against the British . desire to avoid anything that remotely resemble a monarchy , Congress negotiate the Articles of Confederation to establish a weak alliance between the state . as a central authority , Congress under the Articles be without any legislative power ; it could make its own resolution , determination , and regulation , but not any law , nor any tax or local commercial regulation enforceable upon citizen . 
in 1776 , the thirteen colony , act through the second Continental Congress , declare political independence from great Britain during the american revolution . the new state , though independent of each other as nation state , recognize the necessity of closely coordinate they effort against the British . desire to avoid anything that remotely resemble a monarchy , Congress negotiate the Articles of Confederation to establish a weak alliance between the state . as a central authority , Congress under the Articles be without any legislative power ; it could make its own resolution , determination , and regulation , but not any law , nor any tax or local commercial regulation enforceable upon citizen . this institutional design reflect the conception of how Americans believe the depose british system of Crown and Parliament ought to have function with respect to the royal dominion : a superintending body for matter that concern the entire empire .

in 1996 , Congress attempt to enhance the president 's veto power with the Line Item Veto Act . the legislation empower the president to sign any spending bill into law while simultaneously striking certain spending item within the bill , particularly any new spending , any amount of discretionary spending , or any new limited tax benefit . Congress could then repass that particular item . if the president then veto the new legislation , Congress could override the veto by its ordinary means , a two-third vote in both house . 
in 1996 , Congress attempt to enhance the president 's veto power with the Line Item Veto Act . the legislation empower the president to sign any spending bill into law while simultaneously striking certain spending item within the bill , particularly any new spending , any amount of discretionary spending , or any new limited tax benefit . Congress could then repass that particular item . if the president then veto the new legislation , Congress could override the veto by its ordinary means , a two-third vote in both house . in Clinton v. City of New York , 524 U.S. 417 -lrb- 1998 -rrb- , the U.S. Supreme Court rule such a legislative alteration of the veto power to be unconstitutional .

the president also have the power to nominate federal judge , include member of the United States court of appeal and the Supreme Court of the United States . however , these nomination do require Senate confirmation . secure Senate approval can provide a major obstacle for president who wish to orient the federal judiciary toward a particular ideological stance . when nominating judge to U.S. district court , president often respect the long-standing tradition of senatorial courtesy . president may also grant pardon and reprieve , as be often do just before the end of a presidential term , not without controversy .

except in closely fight swing state , voter turnout be largely insignificant due to entrenched political party domination in most state . the Electoral College decrease the advantage a political party or campaign might gain for encouraging voter to turn out , except in those swing state . if the presidential election be decide by a national popular vote , in contrast , campaign and party would have a strong incentive to work to increase turnout everywhere . individual would similarly have a stronger incentive to persuade they friend and neighbor to turn out to vote . the difference in turnout between swing state and non-swing state under the current electoral college system suggest that replace the Electoral College with direct election by popular vote would likely increase turnout and participation significantly .

Nixon , 418 U.S. 683 -lrb- 1974 -rrb- , that executive privilege do not apply in case where a president be attempt to avoid criminal prosecution .

the state secret privilege allow the president and the executive branch to withhold information or document from discovery in legal proceedings if such release would harm national security . 
the state secret privilege allow the president and the executive branch to withhold information or document from discovery in legal proceedings if such release would harm national security . precedent for the privilege arise early in the 19th century when Thomas Jefferson refuse to release military document in the treason trial of Aaron Burr and again in Totten v. United States 92 U.S. 105 -lrb- 1876 -rrb- , when the Supreme Court dismiss a case bring by a former Union spy .

United States 92 U.S. 105 -lrb- 1876 -rrb- , when the Supreme Court dismiss a case bring by a former Union spy . however , the privilege be not formally recognize by the U.S. Supreme Court until United States v. Reynolds 345 U.S. 1 -lrb- 1953 -rrb- , where it be hold to be a common law evidentiary privilege .

==== legislative facilitator ==== 
the Constitution 's Ineligibility clause prevent the President -lrb- and all other executive officer -rrb- from simultaneously be a member of Congress . 
the Constitution 's Ineligibility clause prevent the President -lrb- and all other executive officer -rrb- from simultaneously be a member of Congress . therefore , the president can not directly introduce legislative proposal for consideration in Congress . 
the Constitution 's Ineligibility clause prevent the President -lrb- and all other executive officer -rrb- from simultaneously be a member of Congress . therefore , the president can not directly introduce legislative proposal for consideration in Congress . however , the president can take a indirect role in shape legislation , especially if the president 's political party have a majority in one or both house of Congress . 
the Constitution 's Ineligibility clause prevent the President -lrb- and all other executive officer -rrb- from simultaneously be a member of Congress . therefore , the president can not directly introduce legislative proposal for consideration in Congress . however , the president can take a indirect role in shape legislation , especially if the president 's political party have a majority in one or both house of Congress . for example , the president or other official of the executive branch may draft legislation and then ask senator or representative to introduce these draft into Congress .

==== lack of enfranchisement of U.S. territory ==== 
Territories of the United States , such as Puerto Rico , the Northern Mariana Islands , the U.S. Virgin Islands , American Samoa , and Guam , be not entitle to elector in presidential election . 
Territories of the United States , such as Puerto Rico , the Northern Mariana Islands , the U.S. Virgin Islands , American Samoa , and Guam , be not entitle to elector in presidential election . constitutionally , only U.S. state -lrb- per Article II , Section 1 , clause 2 -rrb- and Washington , D.C. -lrb- per the twenty-third amendment -rrb- be entitle to elector .

Guam have hold non-binding straw poll for president since the 1980s to draw attention to this fact .

Guam have hold non-binding straw poll for president since the 1980s to draw attention to this fact . this have also lead to various scholar conclude that the U.S. national-electoral process be not fully democratic .

==== disadvantage for third party ==== 
in practice , the winner-take-all manner of allocate a state 's elector generally decrease the importance of minor party . 
in practice , the winner-take-all manner of allocate a state 's elector generally decrease the importance of minor party . however , it have be argue that the electoral college be not a cause of the two-party system , and that it have a tendency to improve the chance of third-party candidate in some situation . 
==== not straightforward ==== 
one view be that the electoral college be overly and unnecessarily complex : 
the electoral college do not provide a straightforward process for select the president . 
the electoral college do not provide a straightforward process for select the president . instead , it can be extraordinarily complex and have the potential to undo the people 's will at many point in the long journey from the selection of elector to count they vote in Congress . 
=== support === 
==== prevent a urban-centric victory ==== 
proponent of the Electoral College claim the Electoral College prevent a candidate from win the presidency by simply win in heavily populated urban area . 
proponent of the Electoral College claim the Electoral College prevent a candidate from win the presidency by simply win in heavily populated urban area . this mean that candidate must make a wider geographic appeal than they would if they simply have to win the national popular vote . 
==== maintain the federal character of the nation ==== 
the United States of America be a federal coalition which consist of component state . 
the United States of America be a federal coalition which consist of component state . proponent of the current system argue that the collective opinion of even a small state merit attention at the federal level greater than that give to a small , though numerically equivalent , portion of a very populous state . 
the United States of America be a federal coalition which consist of component state . proponent of the current system argue that the collective opinion of even a small state merit attention at the federal level greater than that give to a small , though numerically equivalent , portion of a very populous state . the system also allow each state the freedom , within constitutional bound , to design its own law on voting and enfranchisement without a undue incentive to maximize the number of vote cast . 
for many year early in the nation 's history , up until the jacksonian era , many state appoint they elector by a vote of the state legislature , and proponent argue that , in the end , the election of the President must still come down to the decision of each state , or the federal nature of the United States will give way to a single massive , centralized government . 
in he book a more Perfect Constitution , Professor Larry Sabato elaborate on this advantage of the Electoral College , argue to `` mend it , do not end it , '' in part because of its usefulness in force candidate to pay attention to lightly populated state and reinforce the role of the state in federalism . 
==== enhance status of minority group ==== 
instead of decrease the power of minority group by depress voter turnout , proponent argue that by make the vote of a give state a all-or-nothing affair , minority group can provide the critical edge that allow a candidate to win .

==== encourage stability through the two-party system ==== 
many proponent of the Electoral College see its negative effect on third party as beneficial . 
many proponent of the Electoral College see its negative effect on third party as beneficial . they argue that the two party system have provide stability because it encourage a delay adjustment during time of rapid political and cultural change . 
many proponent of the Electoral College see its negative effect on third party as beneficial . they argue that the two party system have provide stability because it encourage a delay adjustment during time of rapid political and cultural change . they believe it protect the most powerful office in the country from control by what these proponent view as regional minority until they can moderate they view to win broad , long-term support across the nation .

==== flexibility if a presidential candidate die ==== 
accord to this argument , the fact that the Electoral College be make up of real people instead of mere number allow for human judgment and flexibility to make a decision , if it happen that a candidate die or become legally disabled around the time of the election .

==== isolation of election problem ==== 
some supporter of the Electoral College note that it isolate the impact of any election fraud , or other such problem , to the state where it occur . 
some supporter of the Electoral College note that it isolate the impact of any election fraud , or other such problem , to the state where it occur . it prevent instance where a party dominant in one state may dishonestly inflate the vote for a candidate and thereby affect the election outcome . 
some supporter of the Electoral College note that it isolate the impact of any election fraud , or other such problem , to the state where it occur . it prevent instance where a party dominant in one state may dishonestly inflate the vote for a candidate and thereby affect the election outcome . for instance , recount occur only on a state-by-state basis , not nationwide . 
some supporter of the Electoral College note that it isolate the impact of any election fraud , or other such problem , to the state where it occur . it prevent instance where a party dominant in one state may dishonestly inflate the vote for a candidate and thereby affect the election outcome . for instance , recount occur only on a state-by-state basis , not nationwide . critic of the current system suggest that the result in a single state -- such as Florida in 2000 -- can decide the national election and thus not keep any problem in such a state isolate from the rest of the nation .

=== National Popular vote Interstate Compact === 
several state plus the District of Columbia have join the National Popular vote Interstate Compact . 
several state plus the District of Columbia have join the National Popular vote Interstate Compact . those jurisdiction join the compact agree to pledge they elector to the winner of the national popular vote . 
several state plus the District of Columbia have join the National Popular vote Interstate Compact . those jurisdiction join the compact agree to pledge they elector to the winner of the national popular vote . the Compact will not come into effect until a sufficient number of state agree to the Compact such that a majority -lrb- at least 270 -rrb- of all elector be pledge to the winner of the national popular vote . 
several state plus the District of Columbia have join the National Popular vote Interstate Compact . those jurisdiction join the compact agree to pledge they elector to the winner of the national popular vote . the Compact will not come into effect until a sufficient number of state agree to the Compact such that a majority -lrb- at least 270 -rrb- of all elector be pledge to the winner of the national popular vote . as of 2016 , 10 state and the District of Columbia have join the compact ; collectively , these jurisdiction control 165 electoral vote , which be 61 % of the 270 require for the Compact to take effect . 
the Compact be base on the current rule in Article II , Section 1 , clause 2 of the Constitution that give each state legislature the plenary power to determine how it choose its elector , though some have suggest that Article I , Section 10 , clause 3 of the Constitution require congressional consent before the Compact could be enforcible .

=== ceremonial role === 
as head of state , the president can fulfill tradition establish by previous president .

William Howard Taft start the tradition of throw out the ceremonial first pitch in 1910 at Griffith Stadium , Washington , D.C. , on the Washington Senators ' Opening Day . every president since Taft , except for Jimmy Carter , throw out at least one ceremonial first ball or pitch for Opening Day , the All-Star Game , or the World Series , usually with much fanfare .

Article two of the United States Constitution provide that the President and Vice President of the United States must be natural-born citizen of the United States at least 35 year old , and a resident of the United States for a period of at least 14 year . candidate for the presidency typically seek the nomination of one of the political party of the United States , in which case each party devise a method -lrb- such as a primary election -rrb- to choose the candidate the party deem best suit to run for the position . the primary election be usually indirect election where voter cast ballot for a slate of party delegate pledge to a particular candidate . the party 's delegate then officially nominate a candidate to run on the party 's behalf . 
Article two of the United States Constitution provide that the President and Vice President of the United States must be natural-born citizen of the United States at least 35 year old , and a resident of the United States for a period of at least 14 year . candidate for the presidency typically seek the nomination of one of the political party of the United States , in which case each party devise a method -lrb- such as a primary election -rrb- to choose the candidate the party deem best suit to run for the position . the primary election be usually indirect election where voter cast ballot for a slate of party delegate pledge to a particular candidate . the party 's delegate then officially nominate a candidate to run on the party 's behalf . the general election in November be also a indirect election , where voter cast ballot for a slate of member of the Electoral College ; these elector in turn directly elect the President and Vice President .

Critic Dana D. Nelson believe president over the past thirty year have work towards `` undivided presidential control of the executive branch and its agency . '' she criticize proponent of the unitary executive for expand `` the many exist uncheckable executive power -- such as executive order , decree , memorandum , proclamation , national security directive and legislative signing statement -- that already allow president to enact a good deal of foreign and domestic policy without aid , interference or consent from Congress . ''

'' she criticize proponent of the unitary executive for expand `` the many exist uncheckable executive power -- such as executive order , decree , memorandum , proclamation , national security directive and legislative signing statement -- that already allow president to enact a good deal of foreign and domestic policy without aid , interference or consent from Congress . '' activist Bill Wilson opine that the expand presidency be `` the greatest threat ever to individual freedom and democratic rule . ''

under section 3 of the fourteenth amendment , no person who swear a oath to support the Constitution , and later rebel against the United States , can become president . however , this disqualification can be lift by a two-third vote of each house of Congress .

the president be elect indirectly . a number of elector , collectively know as the Electoral College , officially select the president . on Election Day , voter in each of the state and the District of Columbia cast ballot for these elector . each state be allocate a number of elector , equal to the size of its delegation in both house of Congress combine . generally , the ticket that win the most vote in a state win all of that state 's electoral vote and thus have its slate of elector choose to vote in the Electoral College .

=== vacancy or disability === 
vacancy in the office of President may arise under several possible circumstance : death , resignation and removal from office .

Article II , Section 4 of the Constitution allow the House of Representatives to impeach high federal official , include the president , for `` treason , bribery , or other high crime and misdemeanor . '' 
Article II , Section 4 of the Constitution allow the House of Representatives to impeach high federal official , include the president , for `` treason , bribery , or other high crime and misdemeanor . '' Article I , Section 3 , clause 6 give the Senate the power to remove impeach official from office , give a two-third vote to convict . 
Article II , Section 4 of the Constitution allow the House of Representatives to impeach high federal official , include the president , for `` treason , bribery , or other high crime and misdemeanor . '' Article I , Section 3 , clause 6 give the Senate the power to remove impeach official from office , give a two-third vote to convict . the House have thus far impeach two president : Andrew Johnson in 1868 and Bill Clinton in 1998 .

Bush briefly transfer presidential authority to Vice President Dick Cheney . in both case , this be do to accommodate a medical procedure which require Bush to be sedate ; both time , Bush return to duty later the same day .

under section 4 of the twenty-fifth amendment , the vice president , in conjunction with a majority of the Cabinet , may transfer the presidential power and duty from the president to the vice president by transmit a write declaration to the Speaker of the House and the president pro tempore of the Senate that the president be unable to discharge the presidential power and duty . 
under section 4 of the twenty-fifth amendment , the vice president , in conjunction with a majority of the Cabinet , may transfer the presidential power and duty from the president to the vice president by transmit a write declaration to the Speaker of the House and the president pro tempore of the Senate that the president be unable to discharge the presidential power and duty . if this occur , then the vice president will assume the presidential power and duty as act president ; however , the president can declare that no such inability exist and resume the discharge of the presidential power and duty .

under section 4 of the twenty-fifth amendment , the vice president , in conjunction with a majority of the Cabinet , may transfer the presidential power and duty from the president to the vice president by transmit a write declaration to the Speaker of the House and the president pro tempore of the Senate that the president be unable to discharge the presidential power and duty . if this occur , then the vice president will assume the presidential power and duty as act president ; however , the president can declare that no such inability exist and resume the discharge of the presidential power and duty . if the vice president and Cabinet contest this claim , it be up to Congress , which must meet within two day if not already in session , to decide the merit of the claim .

the United States Constitution mention the resignation of the president , but do not regulate its form or the condition for its validity . 
the United States Constitution mention the resignation of the president , but do not regulate its form or the condition for its validity . pursuant to federal law , the only valid evidence of the president 's resignation be a write instrument to that effect , sign by the president and deliver to the office of the Secretary of State . 
the United States Constitution mention the resignation of the president , but do not regulate its form or the condition for its validity . pursuant to federal law , the only valid evidence of the president 's resignation be a write instrument to that effect , sign by the president and deliver to the office of the Secretary of State . this have only occur once , when Richard Nixon deliver a letter to Henry Kissinger to that effect .

section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . 
section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 provide that if the office of President and Vice President be each either vacant or be hold by a disabled person , the next officer in the presidential line of succession , the Speaker of the House , become acting president . 
section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 provide that if the office of President and Vice President be each either vacant or be hold by a disabled person , the next officer in the presidential line of succession , the Speaker of the House , become acting president . the line then extend to the President pro tempore of the Senate , follow by every member of the Cabinet . 
section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 provide that if the office of President and Vice President be each either vacant or be hold by a disabled person , the next officer in the presidential line of succession , the Speaker of the House , become acting president . the line then extend to the President pro tempore of the Senate , follow by every member of the Cabinet . these person must fulfill all eligibility requirement of the office of President to be eligible to become acting president ; ineligible individual be skip . 
section 1 of the Twenty-fifth Amendment state that the vice president become president upon the removal from office , death or resignation of the precede president . the Presidential Succession Act of 1947 provide that if the office of President and Vice President be each either vacant or be hold by a disabled person , the next officer in the presidential line of succession , the Speaker of the House , become acting president . the line then extend to the President pro tempore of the Senate , follow by every member of the Cabinet . these person must fulfill all eligibility requirement of the office of President to be eligible to become acting president ; ineligible individual be skip . there have never be a special election for the office of President .

the White House in Washington , D.C. , serve as the official place of residence for the president . as well as access to the White House staff , facility available to the president include medical care , recreation , housekeeping , and security service . the government pay for state dinner and other official function , but the president pay for personal , family and guest dry cleaning and food ; the high food bill often amaze new resident . Naval support Facility Thurmont , popularly know as Camp David , be a mountain-based military camp in Frederick County , Maryland , use as a country retreat and for high alert protection of the president and guest . Blair House , located next to the Eisenhower Executive Office Building at the White House complex and Lafayette Park , be a complex of four connected townhouse exceed 70,000 square foot -lrb- 6,500 m2 -rrb- of floor space which serve as the president 's official guest house and as a secondary residence for the president if need .

for ground travel , the president use the presidential state car , which be a armored limousine build on a heavily modify cadillac-based chassis . one of two identical Boeing VC-25 aircraft , which be extensively modify version of Boeing 747-200B airliner , serve as long distance travel for the president and be refer to as Air Force one while the president be on board -lrb- although any U.S. Air Force aircraft the President be aboard be designate as `` Air Force one '' for the duration of the flight -rrb- . in-country trip be typically handle with just one of the two plane while overseas trip be handle with both , one primary and one backup . any civilian aircraft the President be aboard be designate Executive one for the flight . the president also have access to a fleet of thirty-five U.S. Marine Corps helicopter of vary model , designate Marine one when the president be aboard any particular one in the fleet . flight be typically handle with as many as five helicopter all fly together and frequently swap position as to disguise which helicopter the President be actually aboard to any would-be threat .
